sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Turkey and Syria are still reeling from the devastating earthquakes that hit the two countries three months ago. 48 hours of tremors produced quakes of a magnitude of 7.8 and 7.6, killing at least 50,000 people in southern Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Over 7,000 died in northwest Syria, a region already struggling desperately with ongoing civil war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is an area that has been under conflict for over a decade now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And I think what's really key to remember is that it's almost impossible to separate the needs which existed in northwest Syria before the earthquake from really after the earthquake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Even before the earthquake, at least 4.1 million people in northwest Syria, which is around 90% of the population, were reliant on humanitarian aid to meet their most basic needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: You know, this is also an area that has a huge population of internally displaced persons many of whom are living with very real physical and mental scars of over a decade of conflict and who have been displaced multiple times already even before this earthquake. Back in Turkey over 100,000 buildings crumbled. Many point the blame at a government policy to grant planning amnesties, meaning contractors could skirt building regulations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: According to a UN report, around three million Turks were relocated. But 20 per cent of those who moved are now returning to affected areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We see a lot of displacement in the north of the country and Izmir, Ankara, Istanbul, Konya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And we can track that as UNICEF in a very precise way, especially because we follow the enrollment of children in schools.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And definitely there is an hope that a new job could be created also during the reconstruction process. On the 14th of May, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and opposition candidate Kemal Kalic Daroglu will face off in the presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Erdogan came to power 20 years ago amid public outrage over government handling of a previous earthquake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Now the tables appear to have turned and his political future is on the line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Short term in both countries, food and sanitation are the most essential things, but psychosocial support to battle years of trauma will be vital in the long term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: As the climate crisis pushes global temperatures higher, big cities are feeling the heat, with thermometer readings twice as high as rural areas. The combination of air conditioning, traffic build-up and the lack of fountains or green corridors means cities can be a heat trap for the most vulnerable. So, how can we make our cities cooler quickly?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: How do we design our public spaces and how do we make sure that the buildings are better insulated, thermally insulated to protect the people inside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But generally bringing temperatures down in cities by using special types of materials and technologies, but also nature, nature, nature, nature and water in the surface to bring temperatures down. We should keep air conditioning like medicine, giving it to people when they really need it and really keeping it at minimum use. Any delay in implementing measures would risk aggravating the situation further. Professor Harriet Buckley, urban warming expert, advocates immediate action. The first thing, keep what we've got. And the second thing is to try to introduce more nature and blue areas into cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And a lot of our tarmac in cities is also very dark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And the more darker surfaces that we have in cities, the more heat they will absorb.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We could start by just painting our roofs white.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That could be in the form of green walls, green roofs, small street parks, shaded trees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We can think about depaving, so removing some of the pavement that we have in our cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Actually introducing blue areas into cities can be a bit faster than growing the nature that we need in cities to support us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Some cities have successfully implemented measures such as Malmo, Paris, Milan, Barcelona, or Lisbon, but experts warn against the danger of inaction by governments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Adding scientific research has identified the main factors contributing to global warming in cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: A day after a gilded coronation ceremony watched by millions, King Charles and Queen Camilla let others take the center stage as they took in the star-studded entertainment featuring Nigerian singer Tiwa Savage, American pop icon Katy Perry and many others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But then it was the turn of Prince William, Prince of Wales, to compliment his father and the people. Pa, we are all so proud of you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And I also want to express my pride and gratitude for the millions of people who serve in the forces, in classrooms, hospital wards, and local communities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I wish I could mention you all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Your service inspires us and tonight we celebrate you too. I commit myself to serve you all, King, country and Commonwealth. God save the King.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The extended coronation weekend continues for Brits today with what's being called the Big Help Out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The aim is to use volunteering to bring communities together and create a lasting community service legacy stemming from the historic occasion.
